JobFullDesc: This role will be responsible for working directly with the Integrated Product Team Leads / CAMs, the finance manager, and the scheduling team to manage the Earned Value Baseline. This team member will understand all aspects of business program execution, and will be instrumental in the implementation of EVMS process/tools, quarterly EAC compilations, and will support activities associated with monthly SDRL deliverables (Formats 1-7).   We're committed to fostering mentorship and career development for our team members.This candidate will support the quarterly EAC process for the Next Gen OPIR GEO program for both internal and external customers.  You thrive on collaboration and in a communal environment.   You will work in frequent collaboration with others.  You are an excellent communicator.Required Skills:• 5+ Years of Finance work experience• Proficient written and verbal communication skills• Excellent Excel SkillsDesired Skills:• Earned Value / EVMS experience is highly preferred•Ability to effectively analyze EVMS data and communicate information to program leadership.• Utilize effective leadership and organizational skills in centering stakeholders toward a common finance goal by setting priorities and working within EVMS Cadence deadlines.Ability to quickly learn and utilize program management systems and tools• Autonomously create and accurately analyze financial data• PRISM/MRP experience• Ability to obtain SSBI clearanceRequired Education (including Major): Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting or related discipline with 5+  years related work experience OR Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting or related discipline with 3+  years related work experience.“In compliance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the salary range for this role is $72,000-134,500; however, Raytheon Technologies considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, education/training, and key skills.”Benefits offered: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, EAP, education assistance, parental leave, paid time off, and holidaysThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.
